```{r}
install.packages("pacman")
```

```{r}
library(pacman)
library(dplyr)
library(tidyverse)
library(jsonlite)
library(xtable)
library(data.table)
library(stringr)
library(tidyr)
```

```{r}
# Read the text file from JATOS ...

read_file('data/E4/jatos_results_20230223202648.txt') %>%
  
  # ... split it into lines ...
  
  str_split('\n') %>% first() %>%
  
  # ... filter empty rows ...
  
  discard(function(x) x == '') %>%
  
  # ... parse JSON into a data.frame
  
  map_dfr(fromJSON, flatten=T) -> all_data

```

# Demographics

```{r}
demographics <- all_data %>%
  filter(trial_type == "survey-html-form") %>%
  select(ID,response) %>%
  unnest_wider(response) %>%
  mutate(age = as.numeric(age))

age_demographics <- demographics %>%
  summarize(mean_age = mean(age),
            sd_age = sd(age),
            min_age = min(age),
            max_age = max(age))

factor_demographics <- apply(demographics[-1], 2, table)

```

# Pre-processing

```{r}
# Checking to see if 25% of responses during test

test_null <- all_data %>%
  filter(experiment_phase == "test",
         response =="NULL") %>%
  group_by(ID) %>%
  count()

test_null_excluded <- test_null %>%
  filter(n > (120*.25)) %>%
  pull(ID)

ggplot(test_null, aes(x=n))+
  geom_vline(xintercept=30)+
  geom_histogram()+
  ggtitle("Histogram of count of null responses \n for each subject during test")
```

```{r}
# Checking to see if there was 75% or greater response bias during test.

test_response_bias <- all_data %>%
  filter(experiment_phase == "test",
         response !="NULL") %>%
  mutate(response = as.numeric(response)) %>%
  group_by(ID, response) %>%
  count() %>%
  pivot_wider(names_from = response,
              values_from = n,
              values_fill = 0) %>%
  mutate(bias = abs(`0` - `1`)/120)

test_response_bias_excluded <- test_response_bias %>%
  filter(bias > .75) %>%
  pull(ID)

ggplot(test_response_bias, aes(x=bias))+
  geom_vline(xintercept=.75)+
  geom_histogram()+
  ggtitle("Histogram of response bias \n for each subject during test phase")
```

```{r}
# Checking to see if mean response time per subject was less than 300ms.

test_mean_rt <- all_data %>%
  filter(experiment_phase == "test",
         response !="NULL",
         rt != "NULL") %>%
  mutate(rt = as.numeric(rt)) %>%
  group_by(ID) %>%
  summarize(mean_RT = mean(rt))

test_mean_rt_excluded <- test_mean_rt %>%
  filter(mean_RT < 300) %>%
  pull(ID)

ggplot(test_mean_rt, aes(x=mean_RT))+
  geom_vline(xintercept=300)+
  geom_histogram()+
  ggtitle("Histogram of response bias \n for each subject during test phase")
```

```{r}
# Checking to see if accuracy on novel lures was greater than 55%.

test_mean_novel_accuracy <- all_data %>%
  filter(experiment_phase == "test",
         test_condition == "novel") %>%
  mutate(correct = as.logical(correct)) %>%
  group_by(ID) %>%
  summarize(mean_correct = mean(correct))

test_mean_novel_accuracy_excluded <- test_mean_novel_accuracy %>%
  filter(mean_correct < .55) %>%
  pull(ID)

ggplot(test_mean_novel_accuracy, aes(x=mean_correct))+
  geom_vline(xintercept=.55)+
  geom_histogram()+
  ggtitle("Histogram of mean accuracy for novel lures \n for each subject during test phase")
```

```{r}
all_excluded <- unique(c(test_null_excluded,
                  test_response_bias_excluded,
                  test_mean_rt_excluded,
                  test_mean_novel_accuracy_excluded))

length(all_excluded)
```

# Analysis

```{r}
# Collect IDs for the two groups â€” button pressing vs. no button pressing.

button_press_ids <- c()
no_press_ids <- c()

button_press_ids <- all_data %>%
  filter(grepl("press the R button", stimulus)) %>%
  select(ID)

button_press_ids <- button_press_ids[["ID"]]

no_press_ids <- all_data %>%
  filter(!grepl("press the R button", stimulus)) %>%
  filter(grepl("Part I Instructions", stimulus)) %>%
  select(ID)

no_press_ids <- no_press_ids[["ID"]]
  
```

```{r}
# Delineate dataset between the two groups.

bp_data <- all_data[all_data$ID %in% button_press_ids, ]

np_data <- all_data[all_data$ID %in% no_press_ids, ]

```

```{r}
# This is the table to be used for ANOVA.

subject_bp_data <- bp_data %>%
  filter(experiment_phase == "test") %>%
  group_by(ID, test_item_item_type, encoding_instruction, correct) %>%
  summarize(count = n()) %>%
  mutate(percent = count / sum(count)) %>%
  filter(correct == TRUE) %>%
  mutate(treatment = "button")

# Table to view results quickly.

bp_data %>%
  filter(experiment_phase == "test") %>%
  group_by(ID, test_item_item_type, encoding_instruction, correct) %>%
  summarize(count = n()) %>%
  mutate(percent = count / sum(count)) %>%
  filter(correct == TRUE) %>%
  group_by(test_item_item_type, encoding_instruction) %>%
  summarize(mean_pct = mean(percent))
```

```{r}
# Table for ANOVA.

subject_np_data <- np_data %>%
  filter(experiment_phase == "test") %>%
  group_by(ID, test_item_item_type, encoding_instruction, correct) %>%
  summarize(count = n()) %>%
  mutate(percent = count / sum(count))%>%
  filter(correct == TRUE) %>%
  mutate(treatment = "no_button")

# Table to view results quickly.

np_data %>%
  filter(experiment_phase == "test") %>%
  group_by(ID, test_item_item_type, encoding_instruction, correct) %>%
  summarize(count = n()) %>%
  mutate(percent = count / sum(count))%>%
  filter(correct == TRUE) %>%
  group_by(test_item_item_type, encoding_instruction) %>%
  summarize(mean_pct = mean(percent))
```

```{r}
# Combine the two `student_` datasets into one.

student_list <- list(subject_bp_data, subject_np_data)

student_all <- rbindlist(student_list)

student_all
```

```{r}
# Convert IVs to factors.

student_all$ID <- as.factor(student_all$ID)
student_all$test_item_item_type <- as.factor(student_all$test_item_item_type)
student_all$encoding_instruction <- as.factor(student_all$encoding_instruction)
student_all$treatment <- as.factor(student_all$treatment)
```

```{r}
student_all
```

```{r}
# Run ANOVA.

anova <- aov(percent ~ test_item_item_type * encoding_instruction * treatment + Error(ID/(test_item_item_type * encoding_instruction)), student_all)
```

```{r}
# Summary for ANOVA.

summary(anova)
```

```{r}
ggplot(data = subject_bp_data) +
  geom_bar(aes(x = encoding_instruction, y = percent), stat = "summary", fun = "mean") +
  coord_cartesian(ylim = c(0.5, 1.0)) +
  facet_wrap(~ ID)
```

```{r}
ggplot(data = subject_np_data) +
  geom_bar(aes(x = encoding_instruction, y = percent), stat = "summary", fun = "mean") +
  coord_cartesian(ylim = c(0.5, 1.0)) +
  facet_wrap(~ ID)
```

```{r}
all_data %>%
  filter(grepl("html-slider-response", trial_type)) %>%
  select("response") %>%
  unlist()
```

```{r}
all_data %>%
  filter(grepl("html-slider-response", trial_type)) %>%
  select("stimulus")
```

```{r}
midtask_questions <- all_data %>%
  filter(trial_type == "html-slider-response") %>%
  select(ID, response, stimulus) %>%
  unnest(response)


q <- midtask_questions %>%
  select(stimulus) %>%
  str_match_all("<p>\\s*(.*?)\\s*</p>")

midtask_questions$question <- q[[1]][,2]

midtask_questions$qnum <- rep(c(1, 2, 3, 4), nrow(midtask_questions)/4)

midtask_questions <- midtask_questions %>%
  select(!stimulus)

midtask_questions

```

```{r}
midtask_questions %>%
  filter(qnum == 1) %>%
  ggplot() +
  geom_col(aes(x = ID, y = response))
```

```{r}
follow_IDs <- midtask_questions %>%
  filter(qnum == 3) %>%
  filter(response >= 70) %>%
  select(ID)

follow_IDs <- follow_IDs[["ID"]]
```

```{r}
midtask_questions %>%
  filter(ID %in% follow_IDs) %>%
  filter(qnum == 2) %>%
  ggplot() +
  geom_col(aes(x = ID, y = response))
```

```{r}
student_all %>%
  filter(ID %in% follow_IDs) %>%
  filter(test_item_item_type == "exemplar") %>%
  group_by(encoding_instruction, treatment) %>%
  summarize(mean = mean(percent))
```

```{r}
implementers <- student_all %>%
  filter(ID %in% follow_IDs)

implementers_anova <- aov(percent ~ test_item_item_type * encoding_instruction * treatment + Error(ID/(test_item_item_type * encoding_instruction)), implementers)

summary(implementers_anova)
```
